metadata.title: Performance, Optimization, and Future Directions
metadata.summary: Covers profiling, memory management, WebAssembly, and upcoming ECMAScript proposals shaping JavaScript’s future.

body: Optimizing JavaScript demands understanding V8 and SpiderMonkey internals, hot-path detection, and memory management. We discuss profiling with Chrome DevTools, Node’s inspector, and Lighthouse, covering CPU bottlenecks, layout thrashing, and GC tuning.

The chapter introduces WebAssembly integration, workers for parallelism, and performance budgets. We close by surveying TC39 proposals—Temporal, Records & Tuples, pipeline operator—and their implications for future architecture decisions.
